item.title: What's new in css-doodle
item.description: I planned to rewrite css-doodle from scratch a long time ago, but there's barely any progress. One reason is that I wanted to make it too perfect but was stuck at the part of parsing all the time. Another reason is creating new things was more attractive to me than tools building whenever I got some time or inspiration.

item.title: King County is first in the country to ban facial recognition software
item.description: King County became the first county in the country to ban government use of facial recognition software. Supporters applaud the newly approved ban on facial recognition software. They said this is a big win for civil rights and privacy. Those worried about facial recognition software say Blacks, Asians, and Latinos are often misidentified by the software.
item.author: (https://www.facebook.com/komonews)

item.description: Google is expanding the scope of its crypto-related advertisement policy, creating a new process for exchanges and wallet providers but nixing ads for ICOs and DeFi protocols.

item.title: Generating Synthetic Data Using a Generative Adversarial Network (GAN) with PyTorch -- Visual Studio Magazine
item.description: Dr. James McCaffrey of Microsoft Research explains a generative adversarial network, a deep neural system that can be used to generate synthetic data for machine learning scenarios, such as generating synthetic males for a dataset that has many females but few males.

item.description: Visual Studio 2019 for Mac version 8.10 is available today! item.title: GOODJOBS
Mass scale manipulation of Twitter Trends discovered
item.description: New EPFL research has found that almost half of local Twitter trending topics in Turkey are fake, a scale of manipulation previously unheard of. It also proves for the first time that many trends are created solely by bots due to a vulnerability in Twitter’s Trends algorithm.

item.title: Despite Dust Storms, Solar Power is Best for Mars Colonies - Universe Today
item.description: [/caption] Dust — a solar panel’s worst nightmare. Is sending solar-powered robots to the Red Planet a bad idea? Mars is a very dusty planet, and Mars dust sticks to everything, especially solar arrays. After all, Phoenix’s death was probably hastened by a Sun-blocking dust storm, and rover Spirit was battered by the combined solar … Continue reading "Despite Dust Storms, Solar Power is Best for Mars Colonies"

item.title: The ARM processor (Thumb-2), part 3: Addressing modes | The Old New Thing
item.description: The ARM processor employs a load-store architecture, but that doesn’t mean that it has to skimp on the addressing modes. Every addressing mode starts with a base register. A base register of pc, may be used only in load instructions, and the value is rounded down to the nearest multiple of 4 before being used in calculations.
item.author: (Raymond Chen)

item.title: Rust for Rustaceans
item.description: For developers who’ve mastered the basics, this book is the next step on your way to professional-level programming in Rust. It covers everything you need to build and maintain larger code bases, write powerful and flexible applications and libraries, and confidently expand the scope and complexity of your projects. Author Jon Gjengset takes you deep into the Rust programming language, dissecting core topics like ownership, traits, concurrency, and unsafe code.
item.author: (by Jon Gjengset)

item.title: Intl - JavaScript | MDN
item.description: The Intl object is the namespace for the ECMAScript Internationalization API, which provides language sensitive string comparison, number formatting, and date and time formatting. The Intl object provides access to several constructors as well as functionality common to the internationalization constructors and other language sensitive functions.
